comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: 43277 Pte Edward Charles Albert Nice, son of Albert and Louise Nice of 79 Newport Road, Leyton, London.  The 10th Essex, having been reconstituted in August after heavy casualties suffered in taking Delville Wood in July [see Pte Frederick Bulwer in this portfolio], were tasked for the assault in the Brigade attack to seize the fortified enemy village of Thiepval on 26th September 1916.  36 men of 10th Essex were killed on this day.//
